meanings.definition: To cause to occur at the same time
meanings.sent1: She synchs her steps with the music while dancing.
meanings.sent2: The dancers synch their movements to create a beautiful performance.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers synch their routines perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The traffic lights synch to allow smooth flow of vehicles.
meanings.sent5: His heart synchs with hers, beating in perfect rhythm.

meanings.definition: To move or operate in unison
meanings.sent1: The rowers synch their oars to move the boat forward.
meanings.sent2: The team members synch their efforts to achieve the common goal.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers synch their strokes gracefully.
meanings.sent4: The birds synch their flight patterns in a mesmerizing dance.
meanings.sent5: The dancers synch their movements seamlessly, creating a stunning performance.
